net.sf.appia.core.memoryManager
Class MemoryManager

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.appia.core.memoryManager.MemoryManager

public class MemoryManager
extends java.lang.Object

This class is used by the events and a Channel to stabilish a maximum number of bytes used by messages that a channel can hold.

Author:
Nuno Carvalho
See Also:
Channel, Message

Constructor Detail

MemoryManager

public MemoryManager(java.lang.String id,
                     int size,
                     int upth,
                     int downth)
Constructor of the class.

Parameters:
id - Identifier of the memory manager.
size - Max number of bytes. It must be a positive integer.
upth - Tolerance margin of the Memory Manager (in bytes) for events going UP.
downth - Tolerance margin of the Memory Manager (in bytes) for events going DOWN.
Method Detail

aboveThreshold

public boolean aboveThreshold(int direction)
                       throws java.security.InvalidParameterException
Verifies if the channel is above the water mark specified by the user in the constructor.

Returns:
true if the amount of memory reached the threshold.
Throws:
java.security.InvalidParameterException

synchronizedAboveThreshold

public boolean synchronizedAboveThreshold(int direction)
                                   throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                          java.security.InvalidParameterException
Block while the used bytes in this memory manager is above the threshold.

Returns:
true if it is above the threshold, false otherwise. This should return always true, but is an open window for future modifications.
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException
java.security.InvalidParameterException
See Also:
Object.wait()

getThreshold

public int getThreshold(int direction)
                 throws java.security.InvalidParameterException
Gets the value of the specified threshold.

Returns:
the value of the specified threshold.
Throws:
java.security.InvalidParameterException

setThreshold

public void setThreshold(int newThreshold,
                         int direction)
                  throws java.security.InvalidParameterException
Sets the threshold for this memory manager. newThreshold must be between 0 and getMaxSize()

Parameters:
newThreshold - the new threshold.
Throws:
java.security.InvalidParameterException

getMemoryManagerID

public java.lang.String getMemoryManagerID()
Gets Memory Manager ID.

Returns:
the Memory Manager ID.

setMaxSize

public void setMaxSize(int newSize)
                throws AppiaWrongSizeException
Sets the Maximum size of memory that the channel of this memory manager can hold. If the new specified value is lower than 0 or lower than the current used size, throws a AppiaWrongSizeException.

Parameters:
newSize - the new size of the memory (in bytes).
Throws:
AppiaWrongSizeException

getMaxSize

public int getMaxSize()
Gets the actual size of the memory (in bytes)

used

public int used()
Gets the amount of memory (in bytes) occupied in the memory manager.

malloc

public boolean malloc(int nBytes)
Reserve an amount of memory.

Parameters:
nBytes - number of bytes to reserve.
Returns:
True on sucess, False if the memory manager do not have this amount of memory.

free

public void free(int nBytes)
Free an amount of memory in the memory manager.

Parameters:
nBytes - the amount of memory to free.
